description.p: The masked man takes one arrow to the chest. Then another. Despite the beating he is taking, he simply won't go down. Suddenly, he leaps towards his attacker and takes flight, leaving acrater in the ground where he stood. Once he grabs ahold of his opponent, he lifts them and throws them into a nearby wall. He picks up the bandit's bow and snaps it in half before turning to greet his adoring fans.

Just when the goblins are about to leave, they see someone walking directly out of the burning village: an elf whose skin is wreathed in crimson flames. The last thing the goblins see is the inferno blooming from her hand.

Within the blink of an eye, the tiefling speeds past theguards, into the tower, and makes their way through thedungeon. The prisoner barely has time to realize he's being saved before he's outside of the castle walls. The tiefling stops to catch their breath for just a moment before speeding right back in, faster than the eye can see.
No matter where they may go, an empowered will always be trying to change the world. Sometimes it's for the better, other times... not so much.

Unlike sorcerers, empowered beings have not been gifted mastery over magic. Instead, they have been given supernatural strength. They can punch with the weight of the world behind them, crush boulders, and are often capable of natural flight.

There are times when an empowered's abilities might seem akin to magic, but this would be a misunderstanding. What arcane abilities they do have are built directly into their physiology. If an empowered can summon lightning from their fingertips, an autopsy would likely find significant mutations in the empowered's hands.

These powers grow and develop in ways that the empowered may not fully understand. Since no two empowered beings are exactly alike in their abilities, no one is well suited to guide them. Being innately different from the rest of their kin gives an empowered the opportunity to be a hero, but it can also lead to a life of villainy.

The key to creating an empowered is figuring out their origin story. Where did you get your powers? Did an alien crystal fuse with you after crash landing on your planet? Has an extra-planar entity chosen you as their champion?

The next important step is to determine how your empowered has responded to their abilities. An empowered can have almost any backstory or alignment depending on how they came to be who they are now. Have they had powers since birth? Did they discover them last week? Are they hiding their abilities, or reveling in them?
You can make an empowered quickly by following these suggestions. First, put your highest ability score in Strength, and your next highest into Constitution. Second, choose the folk hero background.
As an lowercaseclassname, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d12 per empowered level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 12 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d2 (or 7) + your Constitution modifier per empowered level after 1st
Saving Throws:Strength, Constitution
Skills:Choose two from Acrobatics, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, Stealth, and Survival

ul.li: (a) a spear or (b) a quarterstaff
(a) leather armor or (b) scale mail
(a) a dungeoneer’s pack or (b) an explorer's pack
a mask and cape with a design of your choosing

setters.set: A martial class with super powers.

description.p: The first sign that you were empowered was your enhanced strength. While you aren’t wearing heavy armor or wielding a shield, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You can attempt to grapple or shove creatures as a bonus action on your turn.
Whenever you make an unarmed strike using Strength, you can roll a d8 in place of the strike's normal damage. The increases to a d10 at 11th level in this class.

When using the Attack action to make an unarmed strike using Strength, the strike deals an extra 1d4 damage if you are grappling the target or the target is prone. This die increases as you gain empowered levels, as shown in the Pure Strength column of the empowered table.

description.p: While you aren't wearing heavy armor or wielding a shield, you gain the following beneifts: You can attemple to grapple or shove creatures as a bonus action, when attacking unarmed using strength, you roll a d{{pure strenght:unarmed}} in place of the strike's normal damage, and deals and additional 1d{{pure strength:dice}}+{{pure strength:damage}} if you are grappling the target or the target is prone.
You're a natural when it comes to feats of gymnastic strength. You gain proficiency in Athletics, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for Strength (Athletics) ability checks.

At 2nd level, whenever you make a Strength check, you can summon up the power that dwells within you to roll an additional d20. You can use this feature after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the d20s is used for the check. As you gain empowered levels, you might gain new abilities that will expend a use of this ability due to the immense effort they require.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Whenever you make a Strength check, you can summon up the power that dwells within you to roll an additional d20. You can use this feature after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the d20s is used for the check. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest ({{constitution:modifier}} max).
As you begin learning to control your strength, you will gain abilities and techniques known as Astounding Powers.

At 2nd level, you gain one power of your choice. Your poweroptions are detailed at the end of the class description. Whenyou gain certain empowered levels, you gain additional powers of your choice, as shown in the Powers Known column of the Empowered table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the powers you know and replace it with another power that you could learn at that level.

If an astounding power has prerequisites, you must meet them to learn it. You can learn the power at the same time that you meet its prerequisites. A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class.
Some of these powers might require your target to make asaving throw to resist the feature’s effects. The saving throwDC is calculated as follows:

center.p: Power save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier

sheet.description: Your Power save DC is {{power:dc}}.

description.p: Once you reach 3rd level, your unique powers begin to truly manifest. Choose the Conduit, Idol, Mutant, Super Soldier, Speed Demon, Titan, or Vigilante manifestation, all detailed at the end of the class description. The manifestation you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 13th, and 17th level.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: At 5th level, you regain all expended uses of Strength Surge when you finish a short or long rest. Additionally, you are considered to be at least large in size when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

sheet.description: You now regain any expended uses of Strength Surge on a short rest. You are considered to be at least large when determinging your carrying capacity, and weight you can push, pull, drag, or lift.

description.p: At 6th level, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

sheet.description: Your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

description.p: By 10th level, you are used to maintaining your grip on your opponents. Your movement speed is no longer halved when grappling targets of your size or smaller.

sheet.description: Your movement speed is no longer halved when grappling targets of your size or smaller.

description.p: Starting at 11th level, your Pure Strength now allows you to use a d10 in place of the normal damage for unarmed strikes you make using Strength instead of a d8.

Additionally, you can unleash a wild and deadly haymaker. Whenever you make an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the strike's damage.
Finally, when you reduce a creature's hit points to 0 with an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, you regain a single use of Strength Surge.

sheet.description: You can unleash a wild and deadly haymaker, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the strike's damage. When you reduce a creature's hit points to 0 with an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, you regain a single use of Strength Surge.

description.p: At 14th level, you cling to life, even when most would give up. When making death saving throws, you regain 1 hit point and a single use of Strength Surge on a roll of 19 or 20.

sheet.description: When making death saving throws, you regain 1 hit point and a single use of Strength Surge on a roll of 19 or 20.

description.p: At 20th level, you've realized the full extent of your powers. You can use this feature at any time on your turn to regain all expended uses of Strength Surge and become immune to all damage until the end of your next turn. Once you use this feature, you must complete a long rest to do so again.

sheet.description: You can use this feature at any time on your turn to regain all expended uses of Strength Surge and become immune to all damage until the end of your next turn. Once you use this feature, you must complete a long rest to do so again.

description.p: Your powers were formed after an encounter with a supernatural elemental event. As a result, you are now a powerhouse of elemental energy. These powers are difficult to control, so be careful not to hurt those closest to you

When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you choose which damage type you're infused with: cold, fire, or lightning. Your chosen damage is referred to as your 'infusion damage.' You gain resistance to your infusion damage. Whenever you land an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, you can use infusion damage in place of the strike's normal damage type.

sheet.description: Your elemental infusion is {{elemental infusion:type}}, you gain resistance to {{elemental infusion:type}}, you can decide whether your unarmed strikes will deal {{elemental infusion:type}} damage or bludgeoning damage.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, you can project a beam of vibrant and deadly energy. You can use the Attack action to attack with this beam, and it benefits from abilities like Extra Attack as normal. To fire the beam, make a ranged attack against a creature you can see within 100 feet of you using Constitution as the ability modifier for the attack. On a hit, this attack deals infusion damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die + your Constitution modifier.

If you take damage of the same type as your Elemental Infusion, your Energy Beam becomes charged, causing it to deal extra damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die until the end of your next turn. As a bonus action on your turn, you can willingly deal infusion damage to yourself equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die. You cannot resist your infusion damage when you deal it to yourself this way.

sheet.description: As an action, make a ranged attack against a creature you can see within 100 feet of you using Constitution as the ability modifier for the attack (benefits from extra attack as normal). On a hit, this attack deals infusion damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die + your Constitution modifier. You can use your bonus action to gain a charge for this beam that will cause it to deal an additional 1d12 damage. If you take damage of the same type as your Elemental Infusion, your Energy Beam becomes charged, causing it to deal extra damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die until the end of your next turn. As a bonus action on your turn, you can willingly deal infusion damage to yourself equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die. You cannot resist your infusion damage when you deal it to yourself this way.

description.p: By 7th level, getting close to you is dangerous. While your Energy Beam is charged, creatures take infusion damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die if they move within 5 feet of you for the first time on a turn or start their turn there.

sheet.description: While you are holding charges for your Energy Beam, creatures take infusion damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die if they move within 5 feet of you for the first time on a turn or start their turn there.

description.p: At 13th level, your Energy Beam can now be sculpted into different shapes. As an action on your turn, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to make a separate attack roll with your Energy Beam against each creature within one of the following areas of effect:

ul.li: Energy Blast: A 15 foot cone in front of you.
Energy Volley: A 10 foot radius sphere located up to 100 feet away from you.
Energy Ray: A line that is 100 feet long and 5 feet wide, projected out from you in any direction.

description.p: As an action on your turn, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to make a separate attack roll with your Energy Beam against each creature within one of the following areas of effect:

ul.li: Energy Blast: A 15 foot cone in front of you.
Energy Volley: A 10 foot radius sphere located up to 100 feet away from you.
Energy Ray: A line that is 100 feet long and 5 feet wide, projected out from you in any direction.

description.p: At 17th level, as an action on your turn, you can unleash a Hyper Beam that is 60 feet long and 5 feet wide, forcing all creatures within range to make a Dexterity saving throw against your power save DC. This saving throw is made with disadvantage if your Energy Beam is charged. Creatures take 12d8 infusion damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Once you unleash your Hyper Beam, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

As an action on your turn, you can unleash a Hyper Beam that is 60 feet long and 5 feet wide, forcing all creatures within range to make a Dexterity saving throw against your power save DC. This saving throw is made with disadvantage if your Energy Beam is charged. Creatures take 12d8 infusion damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Once you unleash your Hyper Beam, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

The Idol is a symbol that the people look to for hope and direction. They are usually everyday individuals who have had the responsibility of power thrust upon them. As such, their powers are simple and effective.

When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you're a humble adventurer, of simple beginnings. You can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn’t already include your proficiency bonus.
Additionally, you gain one of the following proficiencies:

ul.li: Proficiency with a language of your choice.
Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools of your choice.
Proficiency with a weapon of your choice.
Proficiency with a skill of your choice.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, you lead by example. Once per round, if you land an unarmed strike during your turn, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to embolden an ally of your choice within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you.

While a creature is emboldened, they can roll your Pure Strength die and add the number rolled to an attack or damage roll it just made. Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against the creature, it can use its reaction to roll your Pure Strength die and add the number rolled to its AC against that attack, after seeing the roll but before knowing whether it hits or misses.
The creature ceases to be emboldened after rolling your Pure Strength die. You cannot use this ability on a creature that is currently emboldened.

sheet.description: Once per round, if you land an unarmed strike during your turn, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to embolden an ally of your choice within 20 feet of you that can see or hear you. While a creature is emboldened, they can roll your Pure Strength die and add the number rolled to an attack or damage roll it just made. Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against the creature, it can use its reaction to roll your Pure Strength die and add the number rolled to its AC against that attack, after seeing the roll but before knowing whether it hits or misses. The creature ceases to be emboldened after rolling your Pure Strength die. You cannot use this ability on a creature that is currently emboldened.

description.p: At 7th level, you learn an additional Astounding Power whose requirements you meet. This power does not count against your number of Powers Known. Additionally, you can now use your Strength Surge a number of times equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of twice).

sheet.description: You can now use your Strength Surge a number of times equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of twice).

description.p: At 13th level, so long as you keep fighting, your allies will stick by you through thick and thin. Whenever you use your Exemplar ability to embolden a creature, you become emboldened as well. Additionally, whenever you use your Exemplar ability to embolden a creature, that creature ceases to be charmed or frightened.

sheet.description: Whenever you use your Exemplar ability to embolden a creature, you become emboldened as well. Additionally, whenever you use your Exemplar ability to embolden a creature, that creature ceases to be charmed or frightened.

description.p: At 17th level, your sense of purpose gives you the strength to face down your destiny. You can use a bonus action to regain a single use of Strength Surge. For one minute after using this ability, or until you are incapacitated, you regain a use of Strength Surge at the start of each of your turns. Once you use this ability, you must complete a long rest to use it again.

sheet.description: You can use a bonus action to regain a single use of Strength Surge. For one minute after using this ability, or until you are incapacitated, you regain a use of Strength Surge at the start of each of your turns. Once you use this ability, you must complete a long rest to use it again.

description.p: You walk the line between what is natural and what is monstrous. Your physiology has been permanently altered. Perhaps you were born this way, or maybe you survived a horrible experiment. You have to live with what you are.
When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you can morph your limbs into weapons. As a bonus action, choose one of the following properties to give your unarmed strike:

ul.li: Bio-Sword: Your unarmed strike deals slashing damage. When you score a critical hit against a creature with an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, the creature is poisoned until the start of your next turn.
Bio-Spear: Your unarmed strike deals piercing damage, and has the reach property.
Bio-Hammer: When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, they cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn.

description.p: Your unarmed strike retains the chosen property until you use a bonus action to either choose a new property or return your body to its normal shape.

sheet.description: As a bonus action, choose one of the following properties for your unarmed strike: (a)Sword, strikes deal slashing damage, and crits with Pure Strength becomes poisoned until the start of your next turn, (b)your unarmed strikes deal piercing and have the reach property, or (c)attacked with unarmed attacks on a creature cannot take reactions til the start of their next turn.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, your Bio-Weapon can absorb a fragment of your target's identity. You can cast Disguise Self at will, but only to assume the form of medium sized humanoid creatures that you have killed using your Bio-Weapon. When you kill a humanoid creature using your Bio-Weapon, you learn their name, age, occupation, and alignment.

sheet.description: You can cast Disguise Self at will, but only to assume the form of medium sized humanoid creatures that you have killed using your Bio-Weapon. When you kill a humanoid creature using your Bio-Weapon, you learn their name, age, occupation, and alignment.

description.p: At 7th level, while grappling a hostile creature, you can use your action to adopt some of their physical properties. For 1 minute, you gain any unique senses, resistances, or immunities that the creature has. This does not work for senses, resistances, or immunities granted by items.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

sheet.description: While grappling a hostile creature, you can use your action to adopt some of their physical properties. For 1 minute, you gain any unique senses, resistances, or immunities that the creature has. This does not work for senses, resistances, or immunities granted by items.

description.p: At 13th level, your shapeshifting abilities are fine-tuned. As an action on your turn, you can expend a use of a Strength Surge to assume the shape of an inanimate object you have seen that weighs no more than 100 pounds and takes up no more space than a 5 foot cube. You can maintain this shape for up to 10 minutes while you maintain concentration (as if concentrating on a spell).

You cannot move or take normal actions while shapeshifted. The only action you can take is to return to your normal form. You assume the shape of the object, but not its texture or temperature. Creatures can tell that something is off with you if they touch you, as you will still feel organic.

sheet.description: As an action on your turn, you can expend a use of a Strength Surge to assume the shape of an inanimate object you have seen that weighs no more than 100 pounds and takes up no more space than a 5 foot cube. You can maintain this shape for up to 10 minutes while you maintain concentration. You cannot move or take normal actions while shapeshifted. The only action you can take is to return to your normal form. You assume the shape of the object, but not its texture or temperature. Creatures can tell that something is off with you if they touch you, as you will still feel organic.

description.p: At 17th level, you can shapeshift one limb into one weapon, and another limb into a different weapon. When you use a bonus action to manifest a Bio-Weapon, you can choose 2 properties for your unarmed strike instead of 1.

sheet.description: You can shapeshift one limb into one weapon, and another limb into a different weapon. When you use a bonus action to manifest a Bio-Weapon, you can choose 2 properties for your unarmed strike instead of 1.

description.p: You're fast. Very fast. Your powers allow you to move at a breakneck pace. You might be infused with the power of light, or favored by a god of speed. Either way, you leave everyoneelse in the dust.

When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, your powers grant you supernatural speed. Once at the start of each of your turns, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to activate your Super Speed, which doubles any movement you gain by Dashing until the start of your next turn.

Additionally you can move through spaces occupied by creatures while under the effects of your Super Speed. If you end your turn on an occupied space, you are forced into the nearest unoccupied space. Moving through a creature's space this way disorients them, which imposes disadvantage on the next attack roll or ability check the creature makes before the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: Once at the start of each of your turns, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to activate your Super Speed, which doubles any movement you gain by Dashing until the start of your next turn. Additionally you can move through spaces occupied by creatures while under the effects of your Super Speed. If you end your turn on an occupied space, you are forced into the nearest unoccupied space. Moving through a creature's space this way disorients them, which imposes disadvantage on the next attack roll or ability check the creature makes before the start of your next turn.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, even without your super speed, you're still pretty quick. You can take the Dash or Disengage actions as a bonus action on your turn.
Additionally, your walking speed is increased by 5 feet. This bonus increases to 10 at 7th level in this class, to 15 at 13th level in this class, and to 20 at 17th level in this class.

sheet.description: You can take Dash or Disengage actions on your turn.

description.p: At 7th level, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to attempt to disarm the target. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your power save DC in order to keep their grip on their weapon.

On a failed save, you take the creature's weapon from their hand. If you are holding an item in your other hand when you succeed with this ability, you can swap that item into the creature's hand as part of the same bonus action.
You must have at least one free hand to use this ability.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to attempt to disarm the target. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your power save DC ({{power:dc}} in order to keep their grip on their weapon. On a failed save, you take the creature's weapon from their hand. If you are holding an item in your other hand when you succeed with this ability, you can swap that item into the creature's hand as part of the same bonus action. You must have at least one free hand to use this ability.

description.p: At 13th level, once you reach top speed, it's incredibly hard to pin you down. Once you reach +30 speed with your Accelerate ability, you do not provoke opportunity attacks, and attack rolls against you are made with disadvantage while you continue to maintain top speed.

sheet.description: At 13th level, once you reach top speed, it's incredibly hard to pin you down. Once you reach +30 speed with your Accelerate ability, you do not provoke opportunity attacks, and attack rolls against you are made with disadvantage while you continue to maintain top speed.

description.p: At 17th level, you can summon all of your energy to move faster than light. You can cast Time Stop as an action on your turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

When you cast Time Stop this way, you can attempt to shove creatures and use your Rapid Disarm without resuming time, and your attempts to do either succeed automatically. Creatures that you shove while time is stopped will only begin to move once time resumes. If a creature is knocked prone or pushed into an obstacle once time resumes, they take 3d10 bludgeoning damage.

sheet.description: You can cast Time Stop as an action on your turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest. When you cast Time Stop this way, you can attempt to shove creatures and use your Rapid Disarm without resuming time, and your attempts to do either succeed automatically. Creatures that you shove while time is stopped will only begin to move once time resumes. If a creature is knocked prone or pushed into an obstacle once time resumes, they take 3d10 bludgeoning damage.

description.p: You discovered your powers during a time of strife, and carried them with you into battle. Learning how to wield your powers and a weapon at the same time wasn't easy. Now that you're acquainted with both, your training shines through.
When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you combine your sheer might with military expertise.

You gain proficiency with battleaxes, warhammers, and longswords if you did not have them already, and can use your Pure Strength while wielding these weapons. These weapons are referred to as weapons of war.
An attack with a weapon of war counts as an unarmed strike for you.

sheet.description: You can use Pure Strength when using battleaxes, warhammers, and longswords(weapons of war). An attack with these weapons count as an unarmed strike for you.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, you learn a fighting style uniquely tailored to your enhanced abilities. You can choose to change your Empowered Fighting Style whenever you gain a new feature for this manifestation.
If you target a creature with an unarmed strike using Pure Strength immediately after making a long jump, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.
While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws.
While you are wielding a versatile weapon with both hands, you gain +1 AC.
If you target a creature with an unarmed strike using Pure Strength immediately after making a long jump, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.

sheet.description: If you target a creature with an unarmed strike using Pure Strength immediately after making a long jump, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.

description.p: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws.

sheet.description: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws.

description.p: While you are wielding a versatile weapon with both hands, you gain +1 AC.

sheet.description: While you are wielding a versatile weapon with both hands, you gain +1 AC.

description.p: At 7th level, you stand firm against the tide of battle. If you have not moved on your turn and you are holding a weapon of war, you can use your bonus action to assume a defensive stance with the weapon. You gain a +2 bonus to your AC until the end of your next turn while you are holding the weapon of war and you aren’t incapacitated. Once you use this ability, your speed is 0 until the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: If you have not moved on your turn and you are holding a weapon of war, you can use your bonus action to gain a +2 bonus to your AC until the end of your next turn, and you aren't incapacitated. Once you use this ability, your speed is 0 until the end of your next turn.

description.p: At 13th level, you can summon up the strength to keep on fighting. Whenever you receive healing, you can add a roll of your Pure Strength die to the number of hit points restored. You automatically regain hit points equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die whenever you take a short rest.

sheet.description: Whenever you receive healing, you can add a roll of your Pure Strength die to the number of hit points restored. You automatically regain hit points equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die whenever you take a short rest.

description.p: At 17th level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor and shields if you did not have them already. You can gain the benefits of your Pure Strength while wearing heavy armor or wielding a shield. If an astounding power requires you not to be wearing heavy armor or wielding a shield, you can ignore the requirement.
Additionally, you gain proficiency with greataxes, greatswords, and mauls if you did not have them already, and can treat these weapons as weapons of war.

sheet.description: You can gain the benefits of your Pure Strength while wearing heavy armor or wielding a shield. If an astounding power requires you not to be wearing heavy armor or wielding a shield, you can ignore the requirement. Greataxes, greatswords, and mauls are now weapons of war.

description.p: When the power inside you simmers over, you transform dramatically, unleashing your true strength for a short time. Some become large, hulking monstrosities, while others find that their hair changes color and they begin radiating energy.

When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you can use a bonus action to assume your True Form for 1 minute, provided that you aren’t wearing armor or wielding a shield. You exit this form early if you are charmed or knocked unconscious, or if you don armor or a shield. You gain the following benefits while in your True Form:

ul.li: You are considered one size larger, though you do not physically grow in size.

description.p: As an action, you gain the ability to see through solid object to a range of 30 feet. Within that range, you have darkvision if you don’t already have it. This special sight lasts for 1 minute or until your concentration ends (as if you were concentrating on a spell). During that time, you perceive objects as ghostly, transparent images. Once you use this power, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

description.p: This simple round shield has a single star at its center. You can use your Pure Strength while wielding it.

This shield can be used as a simple melee weapon that deals 1d8 bludgeoning damage, and doesn't need to be donned or doffed with an action like a normal shield. It has the thrown property, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. On a successful hit, the shield will bounce off of the target and return to your hand.
If this shield's previous owner deems you worthy, then you are proficient in the use of this shield.
This armor was built by a legendary artificer who gave their life to save the universe. The armor is red with golden trim, and a shining diamond is embedded in the chestplate.

Dario built a sentient entity named Silas into this armor. Once Silas deems you worthy of the armor, you become proficient with it, and can use your Pure Strength and the Flight astounding power while wearing it.
Once you are attuned to this armor, you can don and doff it instantly, as every piece of it shall fly to you and attach itself as needed so long as it is within 30 feet of you.
Additionally, while you are attuned to this armor, you can cast Eldritch Blast from the armor's gauntlets using Constitution as your spellcasting ability and without using verbal components.
Silas is neutral good, with an Intelligence of 18, a Wisdom of 16, and a Charisma of 13. They have hearing and darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.
Silas can speak telepathically with creatures within 30 feet of the armor, and can speak, read, and understand Common.

Silas was built after Dario gave up on building weapons, opting to make creations that protect rather than kill. As such, Silas will happily advise and assist their wearer when needed, but only if your intentions are noble.
This skin-tight suit is made up of dragon scales.
While attuned to this suit, you gain the Anatomical Armor astounding power. This does not count towards your number of powers known.
Additionally, you can speak and understand Draconic while you are attuned to this suit.
In order to properly attune to this suit, you must be deemed worthy of it by either a dragon, or the last empowered who attuned to it.

This dark suit of armor appears to be made out of woven threads of metal. When you take damage during combat, this armor gains a charge. Once this armor has 5 charges, you can expend them as a bonus action to do one of the following:

ul.li: Regain a use of Strength Surge.
Make a long or high jump without needing to move 10 feet immediately before jumping. The distance you can cover with this jump is doubled.
Make an unarmed strike.

description.p: This golden whip deals radiant damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die.
You can use this whip to cast Zone of Truth using Constitution as your spellcasting ability. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.
If the whip's previous owner deems you worthy, then you are proficient with this whip.
